content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    questions = []
    answers = []

    for i in eachindex(lines)
        if startswith(lines[i], "# Question")
            push!(questions, String[lines[i+1]:lines[end][begin:findfirst(x->x=="\n", lines[end])-1]...)
            popfirst!(lines)
            continue
        end
        if startswith(lines[i], "# Answer")
            push!(answers, String[lines[i+1]:end])
            popfirst!(lines)
            break
        end
    end

    length(questions) == length(answers || error("No corresponding answer to question")) &&
    length(questions) > 0 && length(answers) > 0 || throw(ArgumentError("Invalid markdown format"))

    (questions[1], answers[1])
end
```

This function extracts all questions and answers from the given markdown text, keeping only the first question-answer pair. The extracted text is stripped of leading spaces and newlines. If the markdown text does not contain a valid question-answer pair or multiple pairs, an error is thrown.
